revised_title: Modeling Cardiac Electrical Activity with Ionic Pumps and Concentration Changes
tldr: This article presents a model of cardiac electrical activity that incorporates ionic pumps and concentration changes. The model accounts for various experimental developments since the M.N.T. model and includes new equations for the sodium-potassium exchange pump, calcium sequestration, and release mechanisms. The model successfully reproduces intracellular sodium concentration changes, action potential duration, and responses to current pulses applied during the plateau and pacemaker phases.
